Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinIsmerts
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in - we usually love our stays with boutique hotels, but this was memorably terrible. The staff is sketchy, the rooms were dirty and outdated, and at one point we had water coming in the front door. Reception never picked up any of our phone calls and the entire organization just seems run down. We felt like we were staying in a dirty 1980's college dorm room. Stains on the sheets, broken safe, dust bunnies everywhere....not to mention the constant puddle of water on the bathroom floor from the shower water leaking out. If it weren't for the pricey cancellation policy, we would have stayed elsewhere. Incredibly disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location if your a party people !!!!”
Reviews.Author: stacey w
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, i went in october low season, but theres actually no low season in playa del carmen, the only bad thing i can say is that they had no cold water, but they offered us another room just to shower...

Reviews.Title: “Love the Blue Parrot!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_on_vacation
Reviews.Content: We had been travelling through Mexico by car. We travelled from Mexico city to Cancun. We stayed in Tulum first, and a t our last day there went down to inspect play del Carmen and it's properties. Because we had done some bidget travelling and beacause playa is a touristic place we reconned we would be spending more then normaly and spoil ourselfs. We checked out diffrent hotels. We preferred to have a hotel at the beach so we did not have to rent chairs and an umbralle every time we went down (and you need onze because there is no natuaral shadow and it is blazing hot). In addition 5th avenue is close to the beach and it is around that area that you can find nice shops and restaurants. After reading some good stuff about the Blue Parrot in our travell guides and walking through the part thats on the beach, we got some info at the front desk. The girl was really nice, the room was 57usd including breakfast. We asked to check it out and it looked wonderfull so we booked 2 days. We actually stayed in the Blue parrot suites (room 131, I believe it was). This is a beautifull complex! We had an enormous bueatifull room! With a big kitchen (bigger then the one a have at home), equipped with everything you need if you want to do your own cooking; a big fridge (the only one we have ancouterd stay at different hotels and hostels througout Mexico and really handy to have you own cold drinks when it is that hot!); a king size cofartbla bed, table and chairs, plenty of storagge room, AC, a safe, a tv and free wifi. The bathroom was nice and fresh towels and soaps were provided dailly. The room was cleaned every day and you get a bottle of free water daily. The breakfast which was included was really yummie and was served at the beachbar where you could begin your day with magnificent shoreviews. Towelservice and use of the umbrellas and sunningbeds was also included. In addition, the Blue Parrot throws partys at night on their part of the beach, and were others have to buy entrance tickets you can get in for free if you stay there. They also have amazing fireshows. We had a nice sitting are outside of our room, which was near the pool and their was also a jucuzzi which could only be used by our room and the room next door. Out of curiosity we asked if we could trie it. The guard said he thought the jacuzzi was broke, but gave it a trie. The jacuzzi filled up, and although the bubbles were lacking (yes indeed the thing was broke) and we had to do it we the light show, we enjoyed in any way. We parked our car on the road in front of the hotel as their was no parking, and although their is a guard 24 hours near the hotel entrance or walking around in the hotel, somebody tried to break in our car. So it's probably better to leave your valuebales in the room. We loved it their so much that we we went down the front desk a couple of times to book some extra nights and ended up satying for almost a week. At one time when we asked to lengthen our stay we normally had to change to the room next door because the room we stayed in was booked. But the next day we found a note under the door to inform us we could just stay in our room. We loved it and hope to return some day!

Reviews.Title: “The manager experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Glolofe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the blue parrot before, and lets face it, its a nice beach 3 or 4 star hotel, you cant ask much for what you are paying for. The hotel has a night club by the same name, and here is where my problems began. I paid $25 for an open bar until 5am, unfortunately i had to discover while in the club, that the information i was given was completely inaccurate. When i called the manager to express my frustration i found a displeasing surprise, at first i thought this guy Juan Pablo wasnt the manager because he was drunk and not polite at all, but i was assured by the rest of the staff he was the manager of the club. After arguing for over 20 minutes whether i heard wrong or what the policy of the club is, or the laws in Mexico i wasnt given any option....lets be honest i could had misheard what the lady who sold me the service or that actually i was misled, but the last thing i was expecting was to be told "take it or leave it", the whole issue could had been solved by confirming the information with her sales employees, but he was not willing to do so. I had the most amazing time at Playa del carmen's night clubs, and Blue Parrot club wasnt the exception until that night. My recommendation for all clubbers....beware of the very rude management at Blue Parrot night club, i hope you dont come across any inconvenience or a reason to speak to the manager there....good luck if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sara44_11
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Awesome staff, everyone so friendly and helpful. Not only is this hotel in the perfect location, but the staff were so nice and accomodating. Within a close walk is the beach and only a block from 5th ave restaurants and shopping. The hotel is clean and well kept with staff consisently working around the clock to keep it that way. We will be back to the Blue Parrot and we will recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ!!!”
Reviews.Author: lalani76
Reviews.Content: I want to first say that I have been a flight attendant with a major airline for 11 years. I have stayed in hotels all over the world, in several different countires. My husband and I have been to Mexico 6 times and will never use this hotel again. We have stayed a at The Fiesta Americana, The RIU Canun, & La Tortuga. There are many things you can overlook, but this place was a mess. We are not hard to get a long with. When we checked in I asked if it was loud at night due to the night clubs in the area? The woman at the front desk replied no, your hotel is down about a block. The first night it was quite, then all hell broke loose. The second night about 10:00 pm we heard yelling and screaming in the court yard. I looked out the window and there were about 15 girls who has just arrived. I noticed they were staying in two rooms. All 15 of them. I figured spring break everyone can get crazy for a night. Well all night until 6:30am they were screaming, yelling, chanting and blowing a whistle. The night club was just down the street. Why they didn't leave and go there is beyond me. That morning at breakfast all the other guest were complaining. The lady at the front desk just smiled and said they are not spring breakers. They are local girls who came for the week end. Again about 10:30 pm the party started. I went on the balcony and it was the same group. I went down stairs to the security guard and asked him to do something. He told me he didn't speak english. I tried to explain and even took him by his hand to show him. I went back to my room. At 4:30am they were still going. I tried to call the front desk no anwser. I went to the security guard again he just shrugged his shoulders. I walked a block to the night club, where the front desk is located. I told security again and they brought out the guy over everyone. He walked back to the hotel and I pointed out what was going on. About 6:30am all was finally quiet. I went to the front desk to complain and was told they were well aware of the problem, due to everyone complaining. I asked her if we could move to another hotel. I explained to her I couldn't go through another night like this. She informed me they would not refund my money, nor would they give me any type of discounted rate. We were stuck. She did tell me the girls had one more night there and then they would be checking out. We had the same problem all over again the next night. I again had to go to the bar to get security and it was the same guy from the night brefore. This time he even had a rum and coke in his hand. I could smell it when he walked up to me. I told him either he do something or I was going back to my room and call the police. I think the party died around 5:00 am. When I woke up there were beer bottles all over, and someone has goitten sick by the pool. I think the hotel should have asked the girls to move to the Blue Parrot up on 5th Ave or even asked them to leave. I paid $153.00 a night for 5 nights at this place. I will never come back and do intend to tell everyone not to use this hotel. I'm 38 years old and enjoy the night life, however this was not enjoyable. In October my husband and I stayed at the La tortuga and I cannot say enough wonderful things about it. We thought we would give this place a try, but what a mistake. There are much nicer hotels, on a better stretch of the beach. Take my word, looks cute, but not a good place to stay. PLEASE feel free to email me if you want any further information.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, convenient and near the beach!”
Reviews.Author: sunlouie
Reviews.Content: After being recommended by a friend we booked a five night stay at the Blue Parrot suites and had a wonderful experience from start to finish. Our kitchenette suite was very nice with extremely comfortable beds and nice appointments throughout. We had two TV's and wireless internet access and a nice view of the beach from our balcony. Every morning we had the complementary breakfast at the Blue Parrot beach club and all of the staff were very friendly and gracious. They also brought us towels and drinks when we used the beach chairs. This was our first time to Playa del Carmen and we had heard that it can get loud at night on the 5th avenue where all the action is. The suites are an easy two block walk from 5th avenue so you can enjoy the nightlife and then go back to the quiet of your room. And the suites are just a block from the beach. We are looking forward to staying here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Could Do Better!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDelia
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been famous since 1984 for it's beach parties, and the hotel suites are located a block away. The first thing we noticed was how our nights sleep were so peaceful, and that the suite complex were very clean. Our suite in particular was very spacious although some of the decor was probably dated back to 1984! The hotel is well located within minutes of 5th Avenue, the many restaurants, bars and clubs, and the only noise was from guests on New Day at about 10am who decided to play their house music as if they were still at the party! This happened again a couple of days later but the problem is reception is located a block away from the suite complex so trying to explain the exact source of the noise was a bit difficult especially on the occasion when we were woken up, but they managed to get it the music turned down, and on the second occasion they asked security to intervene and peace was restored to the complex. On New Year Eve guests were advised that breakfast would be available at 11am but in fact the party was still going on when we duly arrived, and we were advised to come back at noon! the same situation happened a couple of days later when we arrived at 7.30am and the party was still happening, but there was no reception to advise us! A concern was reception was available from xxx until 11pm and I often wondered what guests were supposed to do if they needed emergency assistance after 11pm!! The setting for breakfast was fantastic it was a restaurant on the beach but one morning at breakfast one of the waiters was very aggressive in trying to solicit a tip telling us that the tips he received was his sole wages, also on the same day the Dj decided to test the equipment for the party - the music was so loud, and we were not impressed! At the beginning of our booking on at least three mornings we had no hot water, which was quickly resolved! Also for a couple of days the pool was being used for scuba diving lessons and as guests we weren't given advance notice or whether the pool could be shared on these occasions. On New Years Eve we dined at the hotel's restaurant on 5th Avenue we paid in advance because we were arriving on 28 December and didn't want to find ourselves without somewhere to dine on New Years Eve. The restaurant was set in beautiful surroundings however, the meal was a real disappointment, the soup was salty, the salad was swimming in salad dressing, the prawns were over cooked, the rice and vegetables under cooked needless to say with our 10% discount we didn't return to sample the food at the restaurant based on that experience. The management and staff were very helpful in dealing with our concerns although I didn't quiet believe that the reason for the constant parties at the Blue Parrot and surrounding area was due to a music festival, which I explained that if this were the case then guests making a reservation during this period should have been advised so they could research the type of music festival and make a decision whether or not to use the hotel. Having returned home and looked on the internet it seems it was the BPM Festival from 31 December - 9 January 2011, which explains why the atmosphere surrounding the Blue Parrot felt like Ibiza constant partying, which is good if that is what your holidays are about! It would further would have explained why at about 1am on New Years Day the area leading down from 5th Avenue to the Blue Parrot was like carnival really really crowded!! With a fairly high police presence! I think the Blue Parrot needs to determine whether during this period they try and target clientele who are seeking to attend the festival by promoting it's location as a selling point! However on this occasion in our opinion they didn't get it quiet right in managing both the club and suites with the latter losing out!!

Reviews.Title: “My Idea of Heaven !”
Reviews.Author: deedash
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Blue Parott Suites. There are about 100 restaurants and bars within walking distance of our room. The beach is wide and clean and steps from our room! Morning breakfast on the beach at The Blue Parott was wonderful. The staff is very freindly. They always remember your name! We plan on returning again ! maybe this will be our "go to" place ! There is a nice small spa right around the corner and the location is right in the heart of Playa del Carmen. You don't need a car!

Reviews.Title: “Best value and steps to everything in Playa, 60ft from beach”
Reviews.Author: SalamBalam
Reviews.Content: What an excellent surprise we had after having read "not so good" reviews on this property. We were down there for the Bicentennial celebrations of Mexico's Independence from Spain and we were right in the middle of everything. This is a place with lush vegetation, a pool and with walls enough to let you enjoy a quiet and beautiful atmosphere but at the same time just 60 ft. west from the beach, 60 ft. north of the heart of Playa's nightlife and no more than 6 short blocks from large supermarkets, including Wal-Mart. Playa is a little maze of cobblestone streets packed full of restaurants (all kinds), shops, specialty department stores, water sports, adventure sports and entertainment. The cleanliness of the place is outstanding and one of the very few places that offer this kind of luxury in an unpretencious beach setting. The breakfast/lunch restaurant is right ON the beach and its specialty is to offer American breakfasts/lunches as American as they can be, as well as Mexican too, as Mexican as they can be; we were wondering how they manage this and were told, right by the owner, that they import their key ingredients. The suites are spacious and comfortable and have a full kitchenette in a very modern setting. Since Playa is a flat town and the setting is a lush tropical garden there are only a few rooms that may see through the palm trees into the ocean. Pricewise for us, this property is a top value since it doesn't have many ammenities other than TV, but at the same time why bother? In this case you are not charged for anything that you are not going to use and almost everything is available within the first 80 yards that you can walk in any direction in a really charming Mexican town atmosphere. It was absolutely worth every penny we paid for our stay, not to mention having your own restroom just steps away from the beach, the restaurant and the nightclubs and having a few world-class amusement parks for kids and adults just a 15 minute taxi ride away and a whole island to explore just a 40 minute ferry ride away. Forgot to tell you that the bus station and the ferry dock are just six blocks away with cheap and convenient departures almos every half-hour to Cozumel, Cancun and the international airport.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: malvarezo
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of my all time favorite places in the world. Everything was great from the room to atmosphere, the beach club, everything. Would definetly go back and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: casey98
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I take a few days each year to relax and strategically plan for the coming year. We chose the Blue Parrot for no other reason than the roof top terrace. The suite was quite nice with a functional kitchenette, great semi-firm beds, good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The continental breakfast is worth skipping but the al la carte breakfast is very good. There is an absolutely fabulous dive shop located at the hotel (Reef Quest DIvers) and the hotel is conveniently located to tourist and grocery shopping (Check out the Mega). The staff is fluent in English, helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: cwebb1989
Reviews.Content: I love the blue parrot! My friends and I stayed there for spring break in March 2009. We were all in our freshman year of college, and couldn't have asked for a better spring break. We stayed at the Blue Parrot Suites, which I really recommend because they are down the street from the Blue Parrot Club so you can sleep at night. The beach was across the street, as were the most popular clubs and restaurants. Our room was clean, and from what we encountered with the employees they were helpful. The suites are beautiful, they surround a big pool and it feels like you have a private house or something. The only thing is that they just open up to the rest of the city, there's no gate or anything. There is a security guard on duty at all times though and since there are only a few suites he knew who everyone was. Playa is a very safe city and I never felt in any danger. If you're going for spring break, or any other kind of vacation, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “great value convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Fieldsfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2-bedroom suite with two baths, two mini-friges and a kitchen set up for $99, half-a-block from ocean. Suites are basic and clean, comfortable with two TV's, and have a smallish pool for guests, plenty of outdoor space for lolling in lounges or doing yoga in the morning. One block from Blue Parrot Beach Club, where a very basic continental breakfast, included in price, is served in a beachfront palapa: coffee or tea, fresh fruit and toast and juice. Beachfront restaurant serves only til 5pm. The club turns into a loud and trendy disco after 11pm but you won't hear it from your suite. The purpose of our visit was to get scuba certified and we had a fantastic experience with the on-site dive company, ReefQuest, and owner instructor Steve Flanagan...one-on-one PADI instruction, very thorough and well-organized. Great value too. Had some good meals too, at Mayan influenced Yaxche, and a local fish place called La Pesca.

Reviews.Title: “ever tried to sleep at a dance club?”
Reviews.Author: RobertoLhopital
Reviews.Content: We got there late on Friday (just after midnight), and the bar bouncers did not let us go in, that is how it started. After an almost fist fight we were allowed to check in. Stayed 2 nights, too noisy to sleep due to the many bars (in addition to the blue parrot´s one). Service extremely poor... Try another one if you ever wanna rest or read.

Reviews.Title: “Beware things that bite in the night!”
Reviews.Author: dvaar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Parrot Suites on March 13, 2009. We email the hotel when we made our reservation that our children ages 11 and 14 would share the room with us. When the confirmation was returned we were assured that our room would have two sofa beds and one king size bed, which it did. The problem was even though we had two sofa beds neither one had any bedding. When we checked into the room I directly asked if the beds had sheets and blankets on them, I was assured that they did indeed have all the bedding. After going out for dinner we returned after 10PM and pulled out the sofa beds, both where completely bare. We called the front desk, who said they would send over bedding if they could "find someone" to bring it over to us. The staff arrived with two grungy looking blankets and no sheets. By this time both kids were exhausted and said they would just use the blanket. The next morning my son woke up with 8 huge bits on his arms and legs. I will say that the room was clean though very run down. I guess the spiders or what ever it was that bite my son hide well from the cleaning staff. We will not be back at the suites and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with families. It is definitely for students on break who pile several friends to a room and want to party and aren't too concerned with the look of a place or uninvited bed guests.

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement”
Reviews.Author: bobmex123
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip though cancunfirstclass.com for the blue parrot beach resort. Upon arrival the property they checked us into was not the blue parrot beach resort we had seen in the past. That property was sold 5 years ago and now is called the playa palms. We stayed the first night in the room, a/c did not work, phone did not work, and toliet did not work and private owner above us had a party that kept us up all night. The next morning we went to the front desk to ask about the room problems and inform them that this was the property we had booked. They said we have to contact cancunfirstclass.com to resolve our problem, Because we prepaid. We checked into playa palms at the same rate and had a great time, What a differnce, DONT GO TO BLUE PARROT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Melrose Place”
Reviews.Author: teamparrot
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!!! We staying in the suits and they were fantastic! 6 of us stayed there - it was very cute and cozy just what we needed after staying at the rui cancun for a week. We stayed at the Blue Parrot suites for 3 days and it was great at night time there was a security officer watching doing rounds all the time, felt very safe. We were very loud as we were there for a good time and no one complained- actually when the doors were closed you couldnt hear anything from outside. Other than the last night when we asked for sheets and ice and didnt recieve either and when called back they told us that house keeping was now closed so there ws nothing they could do. They dont speak english- like almost not at all. That was a struggle. When we went to the Blue Parrot nightclub we got bottle service and the server told us what we were to tip him and when we tipped him 20 on 100 he was not happy with that and came back and told us that we needed to tip him more.!!! other than that and the maid stealing money it was Fantastic time! We Cant wait to go back to playa del carmen and AMAZIINNGGG town so fun so much to do I loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room, good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: tylerette
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Blue Parrot Suites in August 2008. Quick rundown on the Blue Parrot - Blue Parrot has 3 buildings in Playa - the Hotel & Beach Club, 5th Avenue, and Suites. They are all on the same block (12 calle and 5th ave area), but BP Suites is much better if you want to be able to sleep at night. The other 2 locations are wonderful if you want to be able to walk out of your room and into a bar/nightclub, but I wanted some distance between Playa's nightlife and my hotel room, so I chose the Suites instead. Absolutely wonderful room - looks exactly like the pictures you see on their website. Stayed in the studio for $110/night (lowest rate I found was by contacting the hotel directly) - spacious room, full kitchen (stove top, microwave, utensils, dishware), balcony with lounge chairs, living room area, and nice big bed. We were only 2 people, but the room could have fit up to 5-6 people. Literally 30 seconds from the beach. I left our room and walked probably 25 meters before my feet hit the sand. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Sure, you can pay $200/night at places like Kinbe, Deseo, or Mosquito Beach, but really, everyone at Playa will end up lounging on the same beach, under the same sun, scuba diving with the same companies, in the same locations (el jardin, tortugas, barracuda, etc.). BP Suites lacks nothing and had everything I needed (oh - except for free wi-fi). PS: Scuba companies to try: Scuba Playa, Phantom Divers. $69 for a 2-tank dive (plus $10 if you don't have your own equipment). $29 for snorkeling (equipment included). Recommend going from June-September if you want to snorkel with the giant whale shark ($129 per person, and is a 2.5 hour drive from Playa each way)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! The best of everything--Prices, room, location!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyLayton
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at the Blue Parrot Suites in February, 2008 and had a fabulous time. We thought the location was unbeatable - less than one block to the beach and close to all the restaurants/bars/shops on 5th Avenue. The room had a contemporary feel with a small sitting area and the bed was very comfortable (a must for me!). Our room was on the 2nd floor and our friends had a room on the 3rd floor with a palapa and the ocean views from their palapa were such a treat! We also really appreciated having a coffee maker, small refridgerator and DVD in the rooms since we were staying for a week (the super market was a short walk away). There are so many hotels in Playa to chose from it was challenging to make a decision, but based on the rooms, location and the value pricing we went with the Blue Parrot Suites and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: SilverTG
Reviews.Content: The Blue Parrot Suites were great. They were very accommodating and helped us with our beach front wedding. The fire show and nightclub were great. Even though it is located in the middle of it all the suites are very quiet. I recommend contacting the hotel to book. They beat any price I found online.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: BeachGal5000
Reviews.Content: I agree strongly with the previous post under same title. The beautiful videos and pictures are of the property that USED to be owned by the Blue Parrot. That part, right on the beach with the beautiful pool, has been bought by Playa Palms as of 2/2007 with no plans to change. The Blue Parrot still has a dance/beach club and the reception still has pictures of their prior building. I inquired about this and they said "it's very difficult right now, we're not talking about it". The Blue Parrot Suites are older and require a short (50m) walk to the beach. Not nearly as luxurius as the other part was. BEWARE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Blue Parrot Suites - Great Stay on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: rochesterny013
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue Parrot Suites 2/25 to 3/1/08 which is one block down from the beach club. The suites are 1 block in from the beach, and do not have beach views, except for the top floor (rooftop) rooms with private palapas. The private pool was very nice and clean. The suites have a great location between La Quinta (5th ave shopping) and the beach. The best part of staying there was eating breakfast (fresh fruit) on the beach at the Blue Parrot beach club. Yes, the Playa Palms Hotel (formerly known as the Blue Parrot Hotel) located next the beach club is nice also, but is quite loud at night due to the adjacent night club, and therefore is not recommended. The suites have a better location, only a block away, and you cannot hear the night club music at night. Our room was quite nice, with a limestone tiled floor and modern shower with glass door. The hotel provides yucatan bath products made from local honey that i loved. If you can afford it, book a rooftop room with private palapas. Another good option is Kinbe Hotel (lonely planet recommended), but it is also not located directly on the beach, but you could eat and hang out at the Blue Parrot beach club. If we visited playa del carmen again, we would probably stay at the Hotel Las Palapas located directly on the beach (booked at the time of our visit). Recommended that you book a tour to the mayan ruins of Chichen Itza and Tulum, an experience of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false advertising”
Reviews.Author: pbb502
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Nov. but it was NOT the Blue Parrot. It is called Playa Palms, and is under new management. It is not afilliated with the Blue Parrot at all. The pictures of the beachfront hotel are NOT the Blue Parrot. For some reason, both on their website and on Trip Advisor they are advertising this hotel. The video on the www.blueparrot.com is of the Playa Palms, not Blue Parrot. Again, buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: JRFT60
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding there in November. Worked with the staff to book a total of 22 rooms between the BP Suites and 5th Avenue Property. Everyone loved the Suites, from broke just of college friends to multi-millionaire family members. Some were less than thrilled with the 5th Avenue property, but no major complaints, just noise and size of the room. Our room was at the Suites and was much better than expected, we usually stay at La Tortuga and the room/experience here was comparable if not better. Breakfast and pool are better at La Tortuga, but you can either walk there or hit up 100% Natural and the beach is closer at the Suites. There was no noticeable noise from the night clubs at the Suites. Despite the fact that the beach disappeared the week prior to our wedding, everything went perfectly. Everything we were worried about before we left the States was beyond our expectations. From the flowers to the photographer to the food to the DJ, all the unknowns in a destination wedding were better than we imagined. I cannot say how much of a pleasure it was to work with Paula (Wedding) and Angela and Mercedes (Rooms/Transportation).

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: ginginHouston
Reviews.Content: We were one of the lucky couples who got married 7/7/07. We found Blue Parrot on the web and contacted Paula the wedding coordinator. From the first email to the last handshake goodbye, Paula and the Blue Parrot were wonderful overall. The club is a great place to have the beach wedding experience. The facilities are beach like and clean, the staff friendly , and the beach amazing! We also went with our guests to party the night before and watched the fire dancers. All of the vendors that Paula had for the wedding, (photographer, florist, DJ, musicians, and decorations), were all very good. Paula is a very professional and generous person who I felt that I could trust with the most important day of my life! The only neutral comment I have was about the food. The fajitas were so so and the way the guests were served was not the most professional. However, this was not the ritz carlton. My husband and I are looking foward to returning to the Blue Parrot and Playa del Carmen soon, if the hurricanes stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Wanna live there”
Reviews.Author: icemaiden82
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to go at first i really wanted to go back to safe old Disneyland florida! Seriously The blue parrot is the best place to stay the staff are really friendly....look out for Edwin at breakfast he's a laugh! I would recommend this as a relaxation/ Party / exploration holiday.....even a kids holiday.... my 9 year old brother loves it! Iv'e been here 3 times now and my parents own one of the blue parrot apartments.....its well worth it! trust me

Reviews.Title: “good room but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: zapper1
Reviews.Content: The room was great - in the building down the street - but the staff was non-responsive. First night noisy neighbors kept us up and the desk did not respond to our calls. When we arrived they forgot to give us the safe key and the remote. When we asked for help finding the aviary ( a great visit) the woman refused to offer assistance. When we asked for a transfer to airport they offered a $60 ride when taxi cabs charged only $40.

Reviews.Title: “Evicted from the Blue Parrot Hotel at Gunpoint!!!”
Reviews.Author: HomerBarks
Reviews.Content: In mid-December (2006) a friend and I were staying at the Blue Parrot Hotel as guests of one of the condo owners. On December 16th we were suddenly evicted by Blue Parrot Security and a large number of other men, some with machine guns, and we and all others staying there were forced out onto the street! It was scary and crazy! What is going on at the Blue Parrot Hotel and why were we evicted at gunpoint? After talking with some of the owners we understood that there has been a disagreement between the condo owners and the Blue Parrot management, but I don’t see how that gives the Blue Parrot the right to take over the hotel and physically throw us out on the street without a place to stay. Also, the police just drove by and didn’t offer to help. After a lot of difficulty we managed to find another hotel for the rest of our stay and we saw that this incident was covered in the local newspapers. This whole thing was frightening. I will never again go near anything that has the Blue Parrot name on it. And after this I probably won’t ever visit Playa del Carmen again.

Reviews.Title: “Turned away after arrival @ Blue Parrot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teritroi
Reviews.Content: Arrived, traveling from Las Vegas, Nevada, on Nov. 8th, after receiving confirmation on Oct. 30th, and with deposit, on room, at the Blue Parrot Hotel. Was told the Blue Parrot Hotel was closed upon arrival!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They said they could relocate us to their other propery on 5th Ave. We went to see it and it was a total S--T hole !!!!!! We were totally upset, after our all day traveling, of over 4000 miles, and then arriving to this !!!!!!! Could not believe that they did not let us know of this before we left.!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Hasski
Reviews.Content: My wife were on our honeymoon and drove past the BlueParrtot (without reservations) on the word of a friend. It was the best surprise all month! The rooms were wonderful, the dtaff were friendly (albeit a bit pushy with "promotions" till we made it clear we weren't interested), the location is absolutely awesome. A few meters away was the Karta Bar; possibly the coolest in Playa. Opposite is the Ohm Bar - very popular with Americans and there were another 4 or 5 bars in the immediate vicinity and the hotel's own bar to boot. The hotel's beach (no beach is private in Playa) was very nice and the location (two blocks from "5th Avenue") was very useful. The ferry stop to Cozumel is a leisurely beach walk away (10 minutes or so) and if you fancy something off the beaten track, the non-tourist part of the city is a 5 minute drive away northwards. The room itself was spacious and the facilities great (fridge, cooker, ketle, etc). There was a mini living room and all rooms come with balconies and hammocks. Our room was not "ocean-front" but the view was good all the same. The bathroom was big and clean and the freebie cleansers and cosmetics were better than many 5-star hotels we stayed at. In short; I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to tour the Yuc. We used it as a base and love every moment

Reviews.Title: “un fair treatment!”
Reviews.Author: TRUBIN
Reviews.Content: We were in Playa for 8 days, on 3 occassions, we went to the BP to party. On our last night there, we were not brought our drinks for over 45 mins. When we asked to speak with a mgr, we were told NONE were there. We told the head waiter we were waiting over 45 mins for our order . After a few mins a waiter brought us 3 bottles of water and 1 drink, After 5-7 mins another waiter brought a duplicate order. We explained that we only placed the original order. we did tip the waiter as we had the past several visits. We were ignored the rest of the time there so we decided to leave. We asked for our bill and was presented a bill of $50.00USD. For 6 bottles of water and 2 mixed drinks. Half of what we actually ordered. when we protested, we were threatened that they were going to call the police. Being 4 university students from TEXAS, we wanted no trouble, so we did pay it and got the heck out of there. The next day we spoke with an American bussinessman with an internet cafe there in PDC who told us the same thing happened to his son last year... BEWARE! We will not return to the BP.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying one night at the Blue Parrot Beachfront hotel. We had booked a four night stay, but had to leave after the first night. We stayed in a "deluxe beachfront studio" which is the most expensive room they offer, right on the beach. The staff was friendly and did their best to make us happy, but the noise was just too much. You are pretty much required to stay awake until 4 AM, which is when the disco music played out front finally ends. The music does not come from the Blue Parrot bar, it's from the Coco Maya night club sandwiched between the Blue Parrot Bar and the Blue Parrot Hotel, which as far as we could tell is not affiliated with the Blue Parrot. I suppose if you can sleep through loud bass-thumping music, or plan to stay up until 4 AM anyway, it might not be a problem for you. I noticed that someone wrote that the noise was not too bad. The only thing I can think of is that the night club must have been closed (or not yet in operation) on the night of their stay. It's true the noise from the Blue Parrot Bar is not too bad as it's pretty far away from the Hotel, and I think the Coco Maya club might be a pretty new thing. The club is popular and fun, you just have to be willing to live right on top of it. On the positive side, the Blue Parrot is located right in the center of town, a short walk from lots of restaurants and clubs. It's also only about 5 or 6 blocks from the Supermarket and Wal Mart. The best thing about the room was the front balcony. It is large and has a fantastic view of the beach. However, our balcony was missing the foot rest of one of the two chairs, and was also missing a cushion on the other chair, which made it a little less than ideal. There were also two dingy twin mattresses laid out on the balcony when we arrived, but these were taken away. In general, the room seemed run-down, and had a pretty bad smell. We never found the source of the smell to be honest. The wicker furniture was kind of sticky (and I'm not sure I want to know why). The refrigerator was rusty, the shower did not get very warm, and there was a really nasty corner of the bathroom floor tile. If you are a clean freak of any kind, this is not for you. There was actually a bird living in our room if you can believe that. The ceilings are very high and made up palm leaves (palapa), and a little bird had made a nest somewhere up there. The building itself looks pretty nice from the outside. It's definitely more run-down inside than out. It is a courtyard design with a small, skinny pool in the middle. The pool is more for show than swimming. Each room has a balcony, and the views are very good as I mentioned. There is a building under construction right next door (inches away), so if you are on that side of the hotel, you will have to put up with construction noise all day. There is another building under construction on the town side of the hotel right across the street. The beach is nice with plenty of beach chairs. We did not try the restaurant. We probably could have put up with the odor and general run-down-ness if it were not for the noise, but we knew we were going to want to get to bed before 4 AM on the rest of the nights of our vacation. The staff were helpful, and there was no problem with us canceling our reservation. They were very understanding and didn't even charge us a fee even though we had reserved the extra nights. They suggested the Blue Parrot Suites, which are a block off the beach. We didn't see the rooms, but based on the location I think it would be quieter. It would be fine to stay somewhere a block or two away from the beach like the BP Suites, as the beach is public and you can still enjoy it all day. We ended up at the Royal Porto Real just down the beach instead (I'll write a review of that as well) which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “muy bueno”
Reviews.Author: marvagladstone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a terrific week at the Blue Parrot Hotel. Our room was at the beach end of the regular hotel section (room 311 - I highly recommend it), and we absolutely loved it. It was a good size studio (with kitchenette) with charming, cozy decor, excellent air-conditoning, books on the shelf, lovely, clean bathroom, and a fantastic little patio with an exceptional view of the blue sea. The beautiful architecture of the hotel building makes for a really wonderful backdrop and great feeling in general. We never had any problem with noise from the beach bar... I'm surprised to hear that people have that problem. I just never heard it loudly. We did have a lot of banging from the next-door construction project, starting as early as 8 am and lasting all day. But we generally got up and out of our room at that time anyway, so it really never became a big problem. I could see it being one if you sleep late. We're more of the late afternoon nap types, and by then it had generally quieted. There is an enormous amount of construction going on all around the hotel, but it didn't really bother us. The beach was great (once again, lots of construction noise as they rebuilt the beach bar palapa that burned down, but what are you gonna do? It looked like they would be done with that project soon so it shouldn't be a problem much longer.) Otherwise we enjoyed the beach a ton. Drink service was good, nice music at perfect volume. Chairs are very comfortable and were always available. Nice people around us, not loud jerk types. The waves are very minimal at the beach here, and there are a number of fishing and diving boats at water's edge, so it's not quite the unspoiled ocean beach that some might be looking for (just up the beach at Shangri-La area the beach is a liitle more like that type; Tulum even more so), but the water was lovely clear blue, sand was soft and ambience beautifully relaxing. We just loved being in the middle of everything but still in a beautiful, relaxed environment. Our only real negative opinion of the Blue Parrot was the restaurant, mediocre at best with very spotty service, which was strange because service everywhere else throughout the hotel was excellent. We didn't really care, though, because it was fun to go up to the main drag for coffe/breakfast (Java Joe's and Hot Bakery were excellent), and Playa Maya restaurant just down the beach was terrific for lunch. Oh, one more thing: The guest services guy was annoying, trying to rope you into wasting some of your vacation time at some sleazy property sales pitch/time share presentation. He kept approaching us by name, and called us at our room, to try to convince us of what great free incentives he had to give us. Ugh. I can only imagine how disturbingly aggressive the sales-pitch people are at the actual presentation if the hotel guy was this bad. It just seems so crummy that they disguise it as "Guest Services." The only service we got was lip service. Advice: Stay away! All in all we thought the Blue Parrot was wonderful and a very good value. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, especially in that exact room which we felt was ideal for us. The hotel is just so pretty, and the location simply can't be beat for those who like to walk around town and feel like they are part of it rather than set away at a big resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Music Every Night”
Reviews.Author: RocketLagunaNiguel
Reviews.Content: Loud music from 10 pm to 4 am everynight..Bring ear plugs! I'm not kidding!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice service, some noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and simple and right on the beach. The receptionist and help are very helpful and polite. They even do your dishes. We didn't know about the continental breakfast, which was very nice. Room also has a fridge. Safe is available too. Pretty nice small kitchenette including plates, cups, glasses, silverware, etc. is also here. Note that you can ask for bags of ice (free), which helps because you can get your beer at WalMart (5 min. walk or $3 cab ride) and keep it cold on the beach. Save tons of money this way. $1 vs $6 for each beer! Note that most of the fishing and diving companies dock their boats on this area of the beach, but if this bothers you a 2 minute walk down the beach solves this. Now for the problems. First, there is a 'greeter' that actually is someone trying to pitch you tours of nicer hotels in their chain in exchange for discounted tickes to nearby attractions. Avoid her to save yourself a few minutes. She will hound you every time you pass by her office. Also depending on where you are located you may hear construction/club noise. I didn't, but I was located in the ideal location to avoid these and I got up early every day. Other people I spoke with complained about this. See my pictures for location of contruction.

Reviews.Title: “Get it right Lonely Planet”
Reviews.Author: SSDixieAustralia
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet - rolled into Playa on a bus, forgoing my usual habit of booking a hotel online prior to arriving. Put my faith in a Lonely PLanet suggestion of the Blue Parrot. Two flights up the tiny stairway (with a poor maid smaller than my suitcase trying to help me), i get to teh room. Crappy sliding glass doors with flimsy curtain behind them greeted me. Inside - Tv didnt work, the ENTIRE floor through the bedroom and bathroom was soaking wet, like someone has thrown a bucket over the whole surface to clean it, all of the four pillows were mouldy (both pillows and pillowcases). Bedspreads/comforters were less clean than some of the ones in crappy motels in Spring Break locations. I freaked out at the thought of staying in that room, and ten minutes after i had checked in, i had checked out. Though the next hotel wasnt much better. At least the Blue Parrot receptionist quite cheerfully refunded my money and didnt question my wanting to leave..

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Playa Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: confareq
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Blue Parrot Suites. We had been a little apprehensive after we had booked, having then read the negative reviews. We worried for nothing! The Suites were lovely, exceptionally comfortable, and perfectly located. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. And the construction that is going on nearby (indeed all over Playa -- remember Wilma?) did not bother us in the least! This was our fourth trip to Playa Del Carmen. We have stayed at the Barcelo Maya, the Occidental Xcaret, and the Riu Playacar. These big all-inclusives are beautiful, and provide you with everything you could possibly wish for on a vacation. EXCEPT -- you never feel you are truly experiencing the true Playa Del Carmen. You are visiting, yes, but you aren't enjoying everything Playa has to offer because you are at your resort most of the time. We will definitely return to Playa in the future, and will probably stay again in the Blue Parrot Suites.

Reviews.Title: “There was a fire in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There was a fire in the hotel, which makes me uncomfortable about safety. Location is great, but there are plenty of options in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous amounts of noise”
Reviews.Author: amb76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blue Parrot for a friend's wedding in February. The location is fantastic, and the beach is beautiful. However, there were LOTS of negatives: There is UNBELIEVABLE construction noise which starts at 6:00 in the morning. I'm not talking hammers and such - I'm talking floor shaking, ground moving, HARD CORE construction noise. It was totally loud and clear on the beach as well. The night club music noise is also very loud. The air conditioning never worked. The hotel said they would send someone to look at it, but this issue was never resolved. I'm shocked that all of these issues were brought to hotel staff & they didn't offer to do anything to make up for it. With 50 people staying there for the wedding & using them for the wedding ceremony / reception, I would have thought they would work harder for us. The noise was just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “good location hotel not so much”
Reviews.Author: brittanylove
Reviews.Content: i dont think i would even book a room to stay in before i go to playa del carmen there are so many hotels to choose from in alot better shape then the blue parrot.The location was really good and we werent botherd by the noise of construction at all but i do feel that the rooms were overpriced for what you get the furniture and things were old and the sofa in our room had stains on it we expected somthing nicer for what we paid the staff was helpful and always there when you need them and the rooms were cleaned everyday and came with breakfast everymorning to sum it up shop around hotel illusion or the playa maya might have been a better chocie for us next year were going all inclusive

Reviews.Title: “Careful where the put you...6:45 a.m. construction”
Reviews.Author: meluvesnassaumon
Reviews.Content: We checked in and out the same day. I have to give them thumbs up on letting us out of our reservation. We just couldn't stomach the noise. I'm not sensative to noise, but if the put you on the city side...you're in store for loud progressive music until 2:00 a.m. and at 6:45 sharp, 50+ construction workers will start working right outside your window...less than 30 feet. And picture this..you're laying on the beach, soaking up the warm Yucatan sun, overlooking the stunning Carribean emerald waters while sipping your ice cold Corona, just like the commercial...Then....add a loud squelling 75 foot high post hole digger, a bull dozer, 10 people grinding on metal polls and 10 more skill sawing...just kind of ruins the moment. Also, I honestly didn't like the rooms...they're really run down. Yes, the location is nice, but not worth what you have to sacrifice to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Mexico at Blue Parrot Suites. The Suites are a newer property - less than a year old with Tommy Bahama decorating. We stayed in a room that was sold to us as a "penthouse suite with a rooftop terrace." Unfortunately for the Blue Parrot, the beach bar and restaurant they are famous for burned down two days before our arrival. As disappointing as that was, we elected to stay there for our reserved two nights. Upon check in, we were not informed of any effect the fire would have on our room. After unpacking, we soon learned that the tvs and phones were not working because of the fire and would not be restored during our stay. That night we learned that the air conditioning unit in the bedroom was lacking a remote control as a result could not be set to cool the room. We also found out that the rooftop terrace was worthless because the light did not work. The deck off the room itself was also useless as it had a table but no chairs and only one hammock. The light on this deck didn't work either but we took a bulb from a lamp in the room and changed it out to get some light. The terrace itself was disappointing - it had a table that rocked, one hammock and plywood boards laid out as benches. It also had an outdoor shower area that was likely damaged in the hurricane as the broken tiles were broken and lying everywhere. Overall, a very unaccomodating and unappealing terrace. The next morning we went to the office and complained and were told that we had to talk to the manager that would not be there until the nextday. No one was sent to our room to fix any of the problems. That night, a heavy rainstorm occurred. While we were asleep, rain poured into our bedroom and living room under both doors and soaked all of our clothing and our bags. We had to go to the airport wearing the dirty clothes that happened to be in the bathroom and with soggy suitcases filled with wet clothes. Because this was our honeymoon, some of our clothes that were dry clean only were ruined. We explained all of these problems to the rooms manager at check out. She made a call and was authroized to give us a 20% discount off our total stay. I would like to say this was sufficient to compensate us for all these problems but frankly, it was not. The room was advertised as a penthouse deluxe suite and the rate we paid for this room was more per night than we paid at any other five star resort we stayed at on our trip. We expected a room that lived up to a 'penthouse' level and the substantial price. We received a hotel experience that was worse than a budget hotel and if not for our positive attitude, would have ruined the end of our honeymoon. The most postive aspect of this entire experience was the great customer service we recieved when we were booking the room. Next time we are in Playa we will stay at the Acanto or Mosquito Blue as both of these facilities were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Parrot is the name. Noise Pollution is the game”
Reviews.Author: SorJuana
Reviews.Content: This hotel has bought a license from the city to play techno music at earsplitting decibles from midnight until 4 am. They play at maximum volume, leaving the surrounding small hotels largely uninhabitable. Ecological reports show that they are also driving marine and wildlife from the area. If you are brain dead or profoundly deaf or insensitive to sound pollution or voracious capitalism, by all means visit the Blue Parrot

Reviews.Title: “Overrated don't believe lonely planet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Continental breakfast coffee, oj, 2 toast - thats it! Useless decorative swimming pool. Boutique style rooms, shabby condition, ceiling lights not working. Not luxurious, overpriced. Cleaning not to European standards, many mozzies/ roaches. Constantly noisy building sites adjacent on 2 sides. Hotel reception and "restaurant" 150 yds away from rooms along beach or road. Beach packed and noisy. However location at the best end of Playa del Carmen and near to the best bars but there are better cheaper hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Blue Parrot”
Reviews.Author: PeterCMontclair
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Blue Parrot Hotel in Playa. We had a great time and loved the hotel. I can understand some of the poor reviews, there are some draw backs which I will mention below. We were 4 people, myself, my wife and two kids, 18 and 12. We took a suite in the new Blue Parrot Suites which I recommend whether you need the space or not. The Blue Parrot has a major night club and is at a hub of night clubs which can be very loud on some nights. Friends we met that stayed in the Blue Parrot hotel said the music could make it hard to sleep. The Blue Parrot is also not cheap. We thought it was well worth the price. It has a perfect location in Playa, easy to walk to all the shops and restaurants in Playa but away from the busy main street 5th Avenue. It has one of the best beaches in Playa. There are also secluded court yards and balconies where you can just chill. The hotel property, including there beach front and rooms are well maintained. They are still working on some Wilma damage. But otherwise it is just a beautiful place to be. However, if you don't need all the amenities there are less expensive alternatives. As mentioned in another review the day time manager Mercedes is wonderful and so helpful. She arranged restaurant reservations, car rentals, what ever we needed. We liked having the night club near by as our 18 year old daughter spent late nights there with other girls she met. We felt completely safe. The hotel security is always pleasantly present. At the club they put on a Fire Dance show every evening which is spectacular. All in all we loved Blue Parrot and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Construction Next Door”
Reviews.Author: anonPortland
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my third trip to Playa. I expected some construction post Wilma, but not within a foot of our hotel! Out of our 8 day trip we were woken up by construction noise at least 5 days. There is major construction going on next to the hotel and behind the hotel. The other days we were woken up by loud guests. By the time we left other guests were asking to be moved to other hotels due to the noise. Outside of the noise, the location of the hotel is great. The room was fine and the balconies are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to be”
Reviews.Author: gianngianni
Reviews.Content: We were in Phase II Condominium, which was not yet finished by the end of December 2004...that's did not stopped managment from selling stays there. Otherwise the management was very accomodating and made a discount on the room rate, which was a bit overpriced anyway, for the problems caused by unfinished works and unavailable chosen apartment. Location and food are excellent. Nic

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute and Fun Place!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy-n-Ron
Reviews.Content: Stayed at one of the un-airconditioned bungalows ($65.00 a night).... RIGHT ON THE BEACH... fell asleep to the waves..... The Blue Parrot Bar was VERY COOL.... SUPER Firedancers!!!! There were 2 pools to use....... and the NICE Rooms.... looked very nice ( I think they were around $125.00 a night). Had a good time at the B.Parrot!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Blue Parrot for our 10th wedding anniversary and it was great! The rooms were clean, the bathrooms and studio spacious. The patio was enormous with several chairs, a table and hammock. The staff were friendly and accomodating. As far as people previously complaining about seaweed and fishing boats, that is just part of Playa and all beaches have seaweed wash up at certain times. The fishing boats belong to the locals-that's how they make a living. We feel the Blue Parrot was an excellent value for our money. We wanted some place that was not like the Marriott, Hyatt, Hampton Inn or any other hotel chain that we can go to here in the U.S. That's the whole point of being in another culture-to experience that culture and that's what you do at the Blue Parrot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Nice People, Not So Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Donna P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel May 10-13. I had booked a studio room well in advance, and after reading several previous reviews, I confirmed several times--including the day before we checked in. The studio rooms are small, but acceptable--the showers are quite large, actually, as is the balcony. We were in a second floor unit just off the street, number 209. Noise was a continual problem, as our next door "neighbors" in 210 were constantly drunk, fighting, yelling and slamming their doors. Had we been staying more than three nights, I would have insisted we be moved. NOTE: The doors in this place are very loud, and the sound reverberates through the stairwell--and a person speaking in a normal voice out on their balcony sounds like they're right outside your door. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There is no "Breakfast Included," as advertised on the hotel's web page---they give you 20% off of your breakfast if you are staying there. The food was quite good but not earth-shattering. The beach is fine--the sea has seaweed, for heaven's sake, and if you can't handle seaweed don't go to the sea. The fishing boats are a quaint part of the atmosphere, and they did nothing to interfere with enjoying the water. After all, Playa used to be just a fishing village. Playa in general has grown so much that I doubt we will return there. Finally, I have to agree with previous reviews that state that this hotel is somewhat overpriced. It is probably priced to reflect the proximity to Avendia 5, the fact that it is well--known and the hotel's expansion to a third location going in on that street.
